string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: What is an oriented graph?
In a dezoriented graph, how are the edges represented?
Which statement is true about oriented graphs?
In a dezoriented graph, what is the degree of a vertex?
Which of the following graphs can be considered dezoriented?

string-array.name: answers1
string-array.item: A) A graph with edges having directions.
B) A graph with no cycles.
C) A graph with weighted edges.
D) A graph with no vertices.

string-array.name: answers2
string-array.item: A) Edges without any direction.
B) Edges with alternating directions.
C) Edges with multiple directions.
D) Edges with random directions.

string-array.name: answers3
string-array.item: A) They can have cycles.
B) They cannot have cycles.
C) They always have negative weights on edges.
D) They always have a single vertex.

string-array.name: answers4
string-array.item: A) The number of edges connected to it.
B) The weight of the edges connected to it.
C) The distance from the other vertices.
D) The number of vertices in the graph.

string-array.name: answers5
string-array.item: A) A graph representing internet connections.
B) A graph representing a one-way street system.
C) A graph representing social media connections.
D) A graph representing a network of rivers and tributaries.

resources.string: You answered %1$d out of %2$d questions correctly. (%3$d%%)
